cyclone.name: LIDIA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 mi SSE of the southern tip of the Baja California peninsula
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest toward southern Baja California, forecast to cross the peninsula on Friday and then curve northwestward over the Pacific west of Baja into early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Baja California peninsula (near Cabo San Lucas)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Baja California Sur from north of San Evaristo to Loreto and north of Puerto Cortes to Puerto San Andresito
weather_observation.warning_coast: Baja California Sur from Puerto Cortes to San Evaristo and mainland Mexico from Bahia Tempehuaya to Huatabampito
weather_observation.impacted_coast: south-western Mexico and the Baja California peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Very low chance (â‰¤3%) of 34-kt winds late in the 5-day period; sustained gales are unlikely at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the San Diego area from this system.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only spotty light rain possible as remnant moisture drifts northward; heavy rain thresholds unlikely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells may reach southern California beaches early next week, producing strong rip currents that could affect small-craft operations.
